snippet: The gains by Golden Dawn show how the economic collapse has empowered fringe groups, a situation that some in Greece have compared to Weimar Germany.
abstract: Greek ultra-nationalist group Golden Dawn has been trying to broaden its appeal, capitalizing on fears that illegal immigration has grown out of control at a time when the economy is bleeding jobs; experts say group is thriving where the Greek state seems absent, the most virulent sign of how the economic collapse has empowered fringe groups while eroding the political mainstream.

byline.original: By RACHEL DONADIO and DIMITRIS BOUNIAS

lead_paragraph: The gains by Golden Dawn show how the economic collapse has empowered fringe groups, a situation that some in Greece have compared to Weimar Germany.

headline.seo: Far-Right Golden Dawn Sees Opening in Greece’s Woes
headline.main: Hard Times Lift Greece’s Anti-Immigrant Fringe
headline.print_headline: Hard Times Lift Greece’s Anti-Immigrant Fringe
